metadata.Title: CVE-2020-25652 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description: A flaw was found in the spice-vdagentd daemon, where it did not properly handle client connections that can be established via the UNIX domain socket in `/run/spice-vdagentd/spice-vdagent-sock`. Any unprivileged local guest user could use this flaw to prevent legitimate agents from connecting to the spice-vdagentd daemon, resulting in a denial of service. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability. This flaw affects spice-vdagent versions 0.20 and prior.

criterions.comment: spice-vdagent: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
